definition: to insult/to direct bad language at sb/to slag off
to insult/to direct bad language at sb/to slag off

sentences.english: Example: Such a vicious lie could be nothing but a stab in the back.
sentences.chinese: 这种恶毒的谎言简直是暗箭伤人。

sentences.english: The sting of her tongue has scared away many pursuers .
sentences.chinese: 她出语伤人已经吓跑了许多追求者。

sentences.english: Many words cut (hurt) more than swords.
The results of the blasting safety accident of a certain mine in Shaanxi were described.
sentences.chinese: 简述了陕西省某矿区爆破飞石伤人事故的分析结果。

sentences.english: First of all, they must manage their life, a mouth, loose lips, so much hurt.
sentences.chinese: 人生首先要管好自己的一张嘴，祸从口出，话多伤人。

sentences.english: But he was rough and harsh-spoken and difficult when he was drinking.
sentences.chinese: 可是他一喝了酒，就态度粗暴，出口伤人，性子别扭。

sentences.english: Sometimes words hurt more than swords.
sentences.chinese: 恶语有时伤人比刀剑更厉害。

sentences.english: Harman claimed she was the victim of backstabbing by jealous colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 哈曼声称她是嫉妒的同事暗箭伤人的受害者。

sentences.english: The police are worried about the increase in the number of stabbings in the city.
sentences.chinese: 市内利器伤人案增多，警方甚感忧虑。

sentences.english: Bad words hurt people; good words warm people.
sentences.chinese: 恶语一出话伤人，好话一句暖人心。

sentences.english: He used the word too with its cutting edge.
sentences.chinese: 他也使用过这个容易伤人的单词。

sentences.english: It has more force in the evening too. But in the morning it is painful.
sentences.chinese: 其实黄昏的阳光更强，但是早晨的阳光就是那么伤人。

sentences.english: That mean-looking dog is actually harmless.
sentences.chinese: 那只看起来很凶的狗其实不会伤人。

sentences.english: Their dog seems fierce, but he's harmless.
sentences.chinese: 看上去面目狰狞，但不会伤人。

sentences.english: I know hundreds of ways to hurt a mech , so don't think I can't break you.
sentences.chinese: 我知道数百种伤人的方法，所以别以为我不敢毁了你。

definition: to harm sb/to inflict suffering/to victimize/pernicious
to insult/to direct bad language at sb/to slag off
to go off accidentally/to catch fire
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to show off/to try to be brave
violent crime/to commit a violent act (assault or murder)
